div1.p: Carter writes to his wife about life in the Camp Chase Prison. He spends his time making crafts to sell, and is trying to send the money home.

div1.head:
Mrs Eliza Carter, Waynesboro Augusta County Virginia (via norfolk va under flag of truce)
Charles B Carter Prisoner of War at Camp Chase prison Ohio
div1.p: It is with mutch plesure that I seate my self this morning to rite you a few lines hoping that the may find you and the too litel children and co well thear leanes men in Doing good helth and a doing the same I get a plenty of Evrything to eate and weir and I am treated well By All of the Col lens and Captines and I can walk all a Ron the prison it has all Hanes and Lids of it and it has A of ground in Lids of it and We Can Play all kinds of games often of the Time Bute I donte have eney time to I have Bin at worke and making a finger rings and Bes Bines and Sleeve Butons I have to mutch to Doe I had to worke this morning and you know that I dont like to worke on Sunday I Can sell all I can make I sell the Dress Pins at 2 cts ans the Ring at 6 cts and the Sleeve Butons at 1 cts and I can sell them faster than I can make them I have so meney other Rings to start Lets in I dont have mutch time to make meney for my self I make from 8 to 9 charmes per weake and I wish I Could send you the money for I know that you neade it bute I donte know how longe I can have to worke as wea have the Small por in the Prison this was in men taken oute of the Prison yestidday and there are somore Maer a taking it and I donte know how long it may Be before I may take it Bute This air some busy good I hear and the air many attenting to all of the sick tha doe the busy Bect for all the Con you neade not be hearing a Boute men for I am in Prison Bye my self eather thir aire a few of of them hear with mea too all I have to fear is you and the too children But you must stay at Home and Doe the Bect you can for your self + Children I want to sea you busy Bast on the Children too
